poem:
Title: "In Unseen Chains, They Toil"

In the morning's bleak gaze, nurses bold,
Sign bonds in dystopian hold,
Shackled in Trap's viral girth, unseen;
A bitter irony in the dream; 

Of liberty, bamboozled were they,
To pay with soul or pocket's sway.
Yet courage calls, within they strive,
In potent hope, their spirit thrives. 

O fairness wanes, where profits reign,
In the heartland of the free, lay chains.
